UC Berkeley AI and Society
Organizers

Conversations about the AI Act

• Andreas Haupt • •

MIT AI Ethics&Policy, the MIT European Club and the AI & Emerging Tech Caucus at the Harvard Kennedy School co-host a series of events with Gabriele Mazzini from the European Commission.

DALL E depicting a high-risk AI application.

The AI Act is about to be passed in the EU, and large language models are showing unexpected capabilities. The technical nuts and bolts for regulation remain somewhat unclear. Join us and a European regulator in conversations about AI regulation!

Events

  • A first panel is on Friday, April 21, 2023, in the Star Room, 32-D463 (follow descriptions outside to the event, from 12:30-1:30 (lunch provided). Gabriele Mazzini (European Commission) will speak with Sarthak Agarwal (Ex-OpenAI) and Boaz Barak (Harvard) about “The EU AI Act: A Technical Perspective”. For a headcount for lunch, please RSVP
  • Another event, co-hosted with Harvard on April 20, will be a presentation about “The EU AI Act: A Legal and Policy Perspective Perspective”, from 1:15-2:30 in a room in Harvard Kennedy School’s Wexner building.
  • There is also going to be the opportunity to meet the speakers in individual meetings. The signup link will be distributed to the ones who RSVP for the event on Friday.
